segment.target: To use the App-V client user interface, download the existing version from Microsoft Application Virtualization 5.0 Client UI Application.

segment.source: Upgrading from App-V 4.x
segment.target: Upgrading from App-V 4.x

segment.source: You must first upgrade to App-V 5.0.
segment.target: You must first upgrade to App-V 5.0.

segment.source: You cannot upgrade directly from App-V 4.x to App-V 5.0 SP3.
segment.target: You cannot upgrade directly from App-V 4.x to App-V 5.0 SP3.

segment.target: For more information, see:

segment.target: Planning for Migrating from a Previous Version of App-V

segment.target: Upgrading from App-V 5.0 or later

segment.source: You can upgrade to App-V 5.0 SP3 directly from any of the following versions:
segment.target: You can upgrade to App-V 5.0 SP3 directly from any of the following versions:

segment.source: App-V 5.0
segment.target: App-V 5.0

segment.source: App-V 5.0 SP1
segment.target: App-V 5.0 SP1

segment.source: App-V 5.0 SP2
segment.target: App-V 5.0 SP2

segment.source: To upgrade to App-V 5.0 SP3, follow the steps in the remaining sections of this article.
segment.target: To upgrade to App-V 5.0 SP3, follow the steps in the remaining sections of this article.

segment.source: Required changes to packages and connection groups after upgrade
segment.target: Required changes to packages and connection groups after upgrade

segment.source: None.
segment.target: None.

segment.source: Packages and connection groups will continue to work as they currently do.
segment.target: Packages and connection groups will continue to work as they currently do.

segment.source: Steps to upgrade the App-V infrastructure
segment.target: Steps to upgrade the App-V infrastructure

segment.source: Complete the following steps to upgrade each component of the App-V infrastructure to App-V 5.0 SP3.
segment.target: Complete the following steps to upgrade each component of the App-V infrastructure to App-V 5.0 SP3.

segment.source: Step
segment.target: Step

segment.source: For more information
segment.target: For more information

segment.source: Step 1: Upgrade the App-V Server.
segment.target: Step 1: Upgrade the App-V Server.

segment.source: If you are not using the App-V Server, skip this step and go to the next step.
segment.target: If you are not using the App-V Server, skip this step and go to the next step.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The App-V 5.0 SP3 client is compatible with the App-V 5.0 SP1 Server.
segment.target: The App-V 5.0 SP3 client is compatible with the App-V 5.0 SP1 Server.

segment.source: Follow these steps:
segment.target: Follow these steps:

segment.source: Review the Release Notes for App-V 5.0 SP3 for issues that may affect the App-V Server installation.
segment.target: Review the Release Notes for App-V 5.0 SP3 for issues that may affect the App-V Server installation.

segment.source: Do one of the following, depending on the method you are using to upgrade the Management database and/or Reporting database:
segment.target: Do one of the following, depending on the method you are using to upgrade the Management database and/or Reporting database:

segment.source: Database upgrade method
segment.target: Database upgrade method

segment.source: Step
segment.target: Step

segment.source: Windows Installer
segment.target: Windows Installer

segment.source: Skip this step and go to step 3, “If you are upgrading the App-V Server...”
segment.target: Skip this step and go to step 3, “If you are upgrading the App-V Server...”

segment.source: SQL scripts
segment.target: SQL scripts

segment.source: Management database
segment.target: Management database

segment.source: To install or upgrade, see SQL scripts to install or upgrade the App-V 5.0 SP3 Management Server database fail.
segment.target: To install or upgrade, see SQL scripts to install or upgrade the App-V 5.0 SP3 Management Server database fail.

segment.source: Reporting database
segment.target: Reporting database

segment.source: Follow the steps in How to Deploy the App-V Databases by Using SQL Scripts.
segment.target: Follow the steps in How to Deploy the App-V Databases by Using SQL Scripts.

segment.source: If you are upgrading the App-V Server from App-V 5.0 SP1 Hotfix Package 3 or later, complete the steps in section Check registry keys after installing the App-V 5.0 SP3 Server.
segment.target: If you are upgrading the App-V Server from App-V 5.0 SP1 Hotfix Package 3 or later, complete the steps in section Check registry keys after installing the App-V 5.0 SP3 Server.

segment.source: Follow the steps in How to Deploy the App-V 5.0 Server.
segment.target: Follow the steps in How to Deploy the App-V 5.0 Server.

segment.source: Step 2: Upgrade the App-V Sequencer.
segment.target: Step 2: Upgrade the App-V Sequencer.

segment.source: See How to Install the Sequencer.
segment.target: See How to Install the Sequencer.

segment.source: Step 3: Upgrade the App-V client or App-V RDS client.
segment.target: Step 3: Upgrade the App-V client or App-V RDS client.

segment.source: See How to Deploy the App-V Client.
segment.target: See How to Deploy the App-V Client.

segment.source: Check registry keys before installing the App-V 5.0 SP3 Server
segment.target: Check registry keys before installing the App-V 5.0 SP3 Server

segment.source: This is step 3 from the previous table.
segment.target: This is step 3 from the previous table.

segment.source: When this step is required
segment.target: When this step is required

segment.source: You are upgrading from App-V SP1 with any subsequent Hotfix Packages that you installed by using an .msp file.
segment.target: You are upgrading from App-V SP1 with any subsequent Hotfix Packages that you installed by using an .msp file.

segment.source: Which components require that you do this step
segment.target: Which components require that you do this step

segment.source: Only the App-V Server components that you are upgrading.
segment.target: Only the App-V Server components that you are upgrading.

segment.source: When you need to do this step
segment.target: When you need to do this step

segment.source: Before you upgrade the App-V Server to App-V 5.0 SP3
segment.target: Before you upgrade the App-V Server to App-V 5.0 SP3

segment.source: What you need to do
segment.target: What you need to do

segment.source: Using the information in the following tables, update each registry key value under with the value that you provided in your original server installation.
segment.target: Using the information in the following tables, update each registry key value under with the value that you provided in your original server installation.

segment.source: Completing this step restores registry values that may have been removed when App-V SP1 Hotfix Packages were installed.
segment.target: Completing this step restores registry values that may have been removed when App-V SP1 Hotfix Packages were installed.

segment.source: ManagementDatabase key
segment.target: ManagementDatabase key

segment.source: If you are installing the Management database, set these registry keys under .
segment.target: If you are installing the Management database, set these registry keys under .

segment.source: Key name
segment.target: Key name

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: IS_MANAGEMENT_DB_PUBLIC_ACCESS_ACCOUNT_REQUIRED
segment.target: IS_MANAGEMENT_DB_PUBLIC_ACCESS_ACCOUNT_REQUIRED

segment.source: Describes whether a public access account is required to access non-local management databases.
segment.target: Describes whether a public access account is required to access non-local management databases.

segment.source: Value is set to “1” if it is required.
segment.target: Value is set to “1” if it is required.

segment.source: MANAGEMENT_DB_NAME
segment.target: MANAGEMENT_DB_NAME

segment.source: Name of the Management database.
segment.target: Name of the Management database.

segment.source: MANAGEMENT_DB_PUBLIC_ACCESS_ACCOUNT
segment.target: MANAGEMENT_DB_PUBLIC_ACCESS_ACCOUNT

segment.source: Account used for read (public) access to the Management database.
segment.target: Account used for read (public) access to the Management database.

segment.source: Used when is set to 1.
segment.target: Used when is set to 1.

segment.source: MANAGEMENT_DB_PUBLIC_ACCESS_ACCOUNT_SID
segment.target: MANAGEMENT_DB_PUBLIC_ACCESS_ACCOUNT_SID

segment.source: Secure identifier (SID) of the account used for read (public) access to the Management database.
segment.target: Secure identifier (SID) of the account used for read (public) access to the Management database.

segment.source: Used when is set to 1.
segment.target: Used when is set to 1.

segment.source: MANAGEMENT_DB_SQL_INSTANCE
segment.target: MANAGEMENT_DB_SQL_INSTANCE

segment.source: SQL Server instance for the Management database.
segment.target: SQL Server instance for the Management database.

segment.source: If the value is blank, the default database instance is used.
segment.target: If the value is blank, the default database instance is used.

segment.source: MANAGEMENT_DB_WRITE_ACCESS_ACCOUNT
segment.target: MANAGEMENT_DB_WRITE_ACCESS_ACCOUNT

segment.source: Account used for write (administrator) access to the Management database.
segment.target: Account used for write (administrator) access to the Management database.

segment.source: MANAGEMENT_DB_WRITE_ACCESS_ACCOUNT_SID
segment.target: MANAGEMENT_DB_WRITE_ACCESS_ACCOUNT_SID

segment.source: Secure identifier (SID) of the account used for write (administrator) access to the Management database.
segment.target: Secure identifier (SID) of the account used for write (administrator) access to the Management database.

segment.source: MANAGEMENT_REMOTE_SERVER_MACHINE_ACCOUNT
segment.target: MANAGEMENT_REMOTE_SERVER_MACHINE_ACCOUNT

segment.source: Management server remote computer account (domain\account).
segment.target: Management server remote computer account (domain\account).

segment.source: MANAGEMENT_SERVER_INSTALL_ADMIN_ACCOUNT
segment.target: MANAGEMENT_SERVER_INSTALL_ADMIN_ACCOUNT

segment.source: Installation administrator login for the Management server (domain\account).
segment.target: Installation administrator login for the Management server (domain\account).

segment.source: MANAGEMENT_SERVER_MACHINE_USE_LOCAL
segment.target: MANAGEMENT_SERVER_MACHINE_USE_LOCAL

segment.source: Valid values are:
segment.target: Valid values are:

segment.source: 1 – the Management service is on the local computer, that is, MANAGEMENT_REMOTE_SERVER_MACHINE_ACCOUNT is blank.
segment.target: 1 – the Management service is on the local computer, that is, MANAGEMENT_REMOTE_SERVER_MACHINE_ACCOUNT is blank.

segment.source: 0 the Management service is on a different computer from the local computer.
segment.target: 0 the Management service is on a different computer from the local computer.

segment.target: ManagementService key

segment.source: If you are installing the Management server, set these registry keys under .
segment.target: If you are installing the Management server, set these registry keys under .

segment.target: Key name

segment.target: Description

segment.target: MANAGEMENT_ADMINACCOUNT

segment.target: MANAGEMENT_DB_SQL_INSTANCE

segment.source: If the value is blank, the default database instance is used.
segment.target: If the value is blank, the default database instance is used.

segment.target: MANAGEMENT_DB_SQL_SERVER_NAME

segment.target: Name of the remote SQL server with the Management database.

segment.source: If the value is blank, the local computer is used.
segment.target: If the value is blank, the local computer is used.

segment.source: Manually created connection group xml file requires update to schema
segment.target: Manually created connection group xml file requires update to schema

segment.source: If you are manually creating the connection group XML file, and want to use the new “optional packages” and “use any version” features that are described in Improvements to connection groups, you must specify the following schema in the XML file:
segment.target: If you are manually creating the connection group XML file, and want to use the new “optional packages” and “use any version” features that are described in Improvements to connection groups, you must specify the following schema in the XML file:

segment.source: For examples and more information, see About the Connection Group File.
segment.target: For examples and more information, see About the Connection Group File.

segment.source: Improvements to connection groups
segment.target: Improvements to connection groups

segment.source: You can manage connection groups more easily by using optional packages and other improvements that have been added in App-V 5.0 SP3.
segment.target: You can manage connection groups more easily by using optional packages and other improvements that have been added in App-V 5.0 SP3.

segment.source: The following table summarizes the tasks that you can perform by using the new connection group features, and links to more detailed information about each task.
segment.target: The following table summarizes the tasks that you can perform by using the new connection group features, and links to more detailed information about each task.

segment.source: Task/feature
segment.target: Task/feature

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Links to more information
segment.target: Links to more information

segment.source: Enable a connection group to include optional packages
segment.target: Enable a connection group to include optional packages

segment.source: Including optional packages in a connection group enables you to dynamically determine which applications will be included in the connection group’s virtual environment, based on the applications that users are entitled to.
segment.target: Including optional packages in a connection group enables you to dynamically determine which applications will be included in the connection group’s virtual environment, based on the applications that users are entitled to.

segment.source: You don’t need to manage as many connection groups because you can mix optional and non-optional packages in the same connection group.
segment.target: You don’t need to manage as many connection groups because you can mix optional and non-optional packages in the same connection group.

segment.source: Mixing packages allows different groups of users to use the same connection group, even though users might have only one package in common.
segment.target: Mixing packages allows different groups of users to use the same connection group, even though users might have only one package in common.

segment.source: Example: You can enable a package with Microsoft Office for all users, but enable different optional packages, which contain different Office plug-ins, to different subsets of users.
segment.target: Example: You can enable a package with Microsoft Office for all users, but enable different optional packages, which contain different Office plug-ins, to different subsets of users.

segment.source: How to Use Optional Packages in Connection Groups
segment.target: How to Use Optional Packages in Connection Groups

segment.source: Unpublish or delete an optional package without changing the connection group
segment.target: Unpublish or delete an optional package without changing the connection group

segment.source: Unpublish or delete, or unpublish and republish an optional package, which is in a connection group, without having to disable or re-enable the connection group on the App-V client.
segment.target: Unpublish or delete, or unpublish and republish an optional package, which is in a connection group, without having to disable or re-enable the connection group on the App-V client.

segment.source: How to Use Optional Packages in Connection Groups
segment.target: How to Use Optional Packages in Connection Groups

segment.source: Publish connection groups that contain user-published and globally published packages
segment.target: Publish connection groups that contain user-published and globally published packages

segment.source: Create a user-published connection group that contains user-published and globally published packages.
segment.target: Create a user-published connection group that contains user-published and globally published packages.

segment.source: How to Create a Connection Group with User-Published and Globally Published Packages
segment.target: How to Create a Connection Group with User-Published and Globally Published Packages

segment.source: Make a connection group ignore the package version
segment.target: Make a connection group ignore the package version

segment.source: Configure a connection group to accept any version of a package, which enables you to upgrade a package without having to disable the connection group.
segment.target: Configure a connection group to accept any version of a package, which enables you to upgrade a package without having to disable the connection group.

segment.source: In addition, if there is an optional package with an incorrect version in the connection group, the package is ignored and won’t block the connection group’s virtual environment from being created.
segment.target: In addition, if there is an optional package with an incorrect version in the connection group, the package is ignored and won’t block the connection group’s virtual environment from being created.

segment.source: How to Make a Connection Group Ignore the Package Version
segment.target: How to Make a Connection Group Ignore the Package Version

segment.source: Limit end users’ publishing capabilities
segment.target: Limit end users’ publishing capabilities

segment.source: Enable only administrators (not end users) to publish packages and to enable connection groups.
segment.target: Enable only administrators (not end users) to publish packages and to enable connection groups.

segment.source: For information about connection groups, see How to Allow Only Administrators to Enable Connection Groups
segment.target: For information about connection groups, see How to Allow Only Administrators to Enable Connection Groups

segment.source: For information about packages, see the following articles:
segment.target: For information about packages, see the following articles:

segment.source: Method
segment.target: Method

segment.target: Link to more information

segment.target: Management console

segment.target: How to Publish a Package by Using the Management Console

segment.target: PowerShell

segment.target: How to Manage Connection Groups on a Stand-alone Computer by Using PowerShell

segment.source: Third-party electronic software delivery system
segment.target: Third-party electronic software delivery system

segment.source: How to Enable Only Administrators to Publish Packages by Using an ESD
segment.target: How to Enable Only Administrators to Publish Packages by Using an ESD

segment.source: Enable or disable a connection group for a specific user
segment.target: Enable or disable a connection group for a specific user

segment.source: Administrators can enable or disable a connection group for a specific user by using the optional –UserSID parameter with the following cmdlets:
segment.target: Administrators can enable or disable a connection group for a specific user by using the optional –UserSID parameter with the following cmdlets:

segment.source: Enable-AppVClientConnectionGroup
segment.target: Enable-AppVClientConnectionGroup

segment.source: Disable-AppVClientConnectionGroup
segment.target: Disable-AppVClientConnectionGroup

segment.source: How to Manage Connection Groups on a Stand-alone Computer by Using PowerShell
segment.target: How to Manage Connection Groups on a Stand-alone Computer by Using PowerShell

segment.source: Merging identical package paths into one virtual directory in connection groups
segment.target: Merging identical package paths into one virtual directory in connection groups

segment.source: If two or more packages in a connection group contain identical directory paths, the paths are merged into a single virtual directory inside the connection group virtual environment.
segment.target: If two or more packages in a connection group contain identical directory paths, the paths are merged into a single virtual directory inside the connection group virtual environment.

segment.source: This merging of paths allows an application in one package to access files that are in a different package.
segment.target: This merging of paths allows an application in one package to access files that are in a different package.

segment.source: About the Connection Group Virtual Environment
segment.target: About the Connection Group Virtual Environment

segment.source: Administrators can publish and unpublish packages for a specific user
segment.target: Administrators can publish and unpublish packages for a specific user

segment.source: Administrators can use the following cmdlets to publish or unpublish packages for a specific user.
segment.target: Administrators can use the following cmdlets to publish or unpublish packages for a specific user.

segment.source: To use the cmdlets, enter the –UserSID parameter, followed by the user’s security identifier (SID).
segment.target: To use the cmdlets, enter the –UserSID parameter, followed by the user’s security identifier (SID).

segment.source: For more information, see:
segment.target: For more information, see:

segment.source: How to Manage App-V 5.0 Packages Running on a Stand-Alone Computer by Using PowerShell
segment.target: How to Manage App-V 5.0 Packages Running on a Stand-Alone Computer by Using PowerShell

segment.source: RunVirtual registry key supports packages that are published to the user
segment.target: RunVirtual registry key supports packages that are published to the user

segment.source: App-V 5.0 SP3 adds support for using the RunVirtual registry key with virtualized applications that are in user-published packages.
segment.target: App-V 5.0 SP3 adds support for using the RunVirtual registry key with virtualized applications that are in user-published packages.

segment.source: The RunVirtual registry key lets you run a locally installed application in a virtual environment, along with applications that have been virtualized by using App-V.
segment.target: The RunVirtual registry key lets you run a locally installed application in a virtual environment, along with applications that have been virtualized by using App-V.

segment.source: Previously, the virtualized applications in App-V packages had to be published globally.
segment.target: Previously, the virtualized applications in App-V packages had to be published globally.

segment.source: For more about RunVirtual and about other methods of running locally installed applications in a virtual environment with virtualized applications, see Running a Locally Installed Application Inside a Virtual Environment with Virtualized Applications.
segment.target: For more about RunVirtual and about other methods of running locally installed applications in a virtual environment with virtualized applications, see Running a Locally Installed Application Inside a Virtual Environment with Virtualized Applications.

segment.source: New PowerShell cmdlets and updateable cmdlet help
segment.target: New PowerShell cmdlets and updateable cmdlet help

segment.source: New PowerShell cmdlets and updateable cmdlet help are included in App-V 5.0 SP3.
segment.target: New PowerShell cmdlets and updateable cmdlet help are included in App-V 5.0 SP3.

segment.source: To download the cmdlet modules, see How to Load the PowerShell Cmdlets and Get Cmdlet Help.
segment.target: To download the cmdlet modules, see How to Load the PowerShell Cmdlets and Get Cmdlet Help.

segment.source: New App-V 5.0 SP3 Server PowerShell cmdlets
segment.target: New App-V 5.0 SP3 Server PowerShell cmdlets

segment.source: New Windows PowerShell cmdlets for the App-V Server have been added to help you manage connection groups.
segment.target: New Windows PowerShell cmdlets for the App-V Server have been added to help you manage connection groups.

segment.source: Cmdlet
segment.target: Cmdlet

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Add-AppvServerConnectionGroupPackage
segment.target: Add-AppvServerConnectionGroupPackage

segment.source: Appends a package to the end of a connection group's package list and enables you to configure the package as optional and/or with no version within the connection group.
segment.target: Appends a package to the end of a connection group's package list and enables you to configure the package as optional and/or with no version within the connection group.

segment.source: Set-AppvServerConnectionGroupPackage
segment.target: Set-AppvServerConnectionGroupPackage

segment.source: Enables you to edit details about the connection group package, such as whether it is optional.
segment.target: Enables you to edit details about the connection group package, such as whether it is optional.

segment.source: Remove-AppvServerConnectionGroupPackage
segment.target: Remove-AppvServerConnectionGroupPackage

segment.source: Removes a package from a connection group.
segment.target: Removes a package from a connection group.

segment.target: Type one of the following commands to load the cmdlets for the module you want:

segment.source: Primary virtual application directory (PVAD) is hidden but can be turned on
segment.target: Primary virtual application directory (PVAD) is hidden but can be turned on

segment.source: The primary virtual application directory (PVAD) is hidden in App-V 5.0 SP3, but you can turn it back on and make it visible by using one of the following methods:
segment.target: The primary virtual application directory (PVAD) is hidden in App-V 5.0 SP3, but you can turn it back on and make it visible by using one of the following methods:

segment.source: Method
segment.target: Method

segment.source: Steps
segment.target: Steps

segment.source: Use a command line parameter
segment.target: Use a command line parameter

segment.source: Pass the –EnablePVADControl parameter to the Sequencer.exe.
segment.target: Pass the –EnablePVADControl parameter to the Sequencer.exe.

segment.source: Create a registry subkey
segment.target: Create a registry subkey

segment.source: In the Registry Editor, navigate to:
segment.target: In the Registry Editor, navigate to:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If the subkey doesn’t exist, you must create it.
segment.target: If the subkey doesn’t exist, you must create it.

segment.source: Create a DWORD Value named EnablePVADControl, and set the value to 1.
segment.target: Create a DWORD Value named EnablePVADControl, and set the value to 1.

segment.source: A value of 0 means that PVAD is hidden.
segment.target: A value of 0 means that PVAD is hidden.

segment.source: More about PVAD: When you use the Sequencer to create a package, you can enter any installation path for the package.
segment.target: More about PVAD: When you use the Sequencer to create a package, you can enter any installation path for the package.

segment.source: In past versions of App-V, you were required to specify the primary virtual application directory (PVAD) of the application as the path.
segment.target: In past versions of App-V, you were required to specify the primary virtual application directory (PVAD) of the application as the path.

segment.source: PVAD is the directory to which you would typically install an application on your local computer if you weren’t using App-V.
segment.target: PVAD is the directory to which you would typically install an application on your local computer if you weren’t using App-V.

segment.source: For example, if you were installing Office on a computer, the PVAD typically would be C:Program FilesMicrosoft Office.
segment.target: For example, if you were installing Office on a computer, the PVAD typically would be C:Program FilesMicrosoft Office.

segment.source: ClientVersion is required to view App-V publishing metadata
segment.target: ClientVersion is required to view App-V publishing metadata

segment.source: In App-V 5.0 SP3, you must provide the following values in the address when you query the App-V Publishing server for metadata:
segment.target: In App-V 5.0 SP3, you must provide the following values in the address when you query the App-V Publishing server for metadata:

segment.source: Value
segment.target: Value

segment.source: Additional details
segment.target: Additional details

segment.source: ClientVersion
segment.target: ClientVersion

segment.source: If you omit the ClientVersion parameter from the query, the metadata excludes the new App-V 5.0 SP3 features.
segment.target: If you omit the ClientVersion parameter from the query, the metadata excludes the new App-V 5.0 SP3 features.

segment.source: ClientOS
segment.target: ClientOS

segment.source: You have to provide this value only if you select specific client operating systems when you sequence the package.
segment.target: You have to provide this value only if you select specific client operating systems when you sequence the package.

segment.source: If you select the default (all operating systems), do not specify this value in the query.
segment.target: If you select the default (all operating systems), do not specify this value in the query.

segment.source: If you omit the ClientOS parameter from the query, only the packages that were sequenced to support any operating system appear in the metadata.
segment.target: If you omit the ClientOS parameter from the query, only the packages that were sequenced to support any operating system appear in the metadata.

segment.source: For syntax and examples of this query, see Viewing App-V Server Publishing Metadata.
segment.target: For syntax and examples of this query, see Viewing App-V Server Publishing Metadata.

segment.source: App-V event logs have been consolidated
segment.target: App-V event logs have been consolidated

segment.source: The following event logs, previously located at Applications and Services Logs/Microsoft/AppV/App-V component, have been moved to Applications and Services Logs/Microsoft/AppV/ServiceLog.
segment.target: The following event logs, previously located at Applications and Services Logs/Microsoft/AppV/App-V component, have been moved to Applications and Services Logs/Microsoft/AppV/ServiceLog.

segment.source: To view the logs, select ViewShow Analytic and Debug Logs in the Event Viewer application.
segment.target: To view the logs, select ViewShow Analytic and Debug Logs in the Event Viewer application.

segment.source: How to Get MDOP Technologies
segment.target: How to Get MDOP Technologies

segment.source: App-V is a part of the Microsoft Desktop Optimization Pack (MDOP).
segment.target: App-V is a part of the Microsoft Desktop Optimization Pack (MDOP).

segment.source: MDOP is part of Microsoft Software Assurance.
segment.target: MDOP is part of Microsoft Software Assurance.

segment.source: For more information about Microsoft Software Assurance and acquiring MDOP, see How Do I Get MDOP.
segment.target: For more information about Microsoft Software Assurance and acquiring MDOP, see How Do I Get MDOP.
